hook.text: In November 2021, thousands of strangers pooled $47 million to buy a rare copy of the US Constitution at Sotheby's.

buildup.text: ConstitutionDAO raised the money in just one week. Contributors got PEOPLE tokens representing their share.

discovery.text: The bid failed. A billionaire hedge fund CEO outbid them at $43.2 million, but the DAO's final price wasn't enough.

twist.text: Refunding contributors cost more in gas fees than some people originally donated. Small holders lost money just claiming refunds.

climax.text: ConstitutionDAO failed at buying the Constitution but succeeded in proving DAOs could mobilize millions overnight.

punchline.text: They lost the auction but proved a crowd can outbid billionaires.

quiz.question: What happened to ConstitutionDAO's bid?
options: A billionaire outbid them at Sotheby's
